File libsrc/libgmethod/tapers.c

A GMethod for the application of a data taper. Several types of tapers are possible. 
  typedef struct
  {
 	GObjectPart	core;
 	GMethodPart	gm;
  
 	char		type[10];
 	int		width;
 	int		minpts;
 	int		maxpts;
  } *Taper;

See Also:

Public Functions

new_Taper_fromString 
 Taper new_Taper_fromString(const char *s)
Create a Taper object from a string description. Taper is a GMethod that applies a taper to a waveform. The string description should contain the parameter names and values in the form "name1=value1 name2=value". The order of the name/value pairs is arbitrary. Defaults are used for values not specified. Example: 
      "type=cosine width=5 minpts=10 maxpts=100"
Taper types are "hamming", "hanning", "cosine", "cosineBeg", "parzen", and "none".

Parameters:
s - The string taper description.
Returns:
a Taper object, or NULL if malloc fails (logErrorMsg will be called)
Taper_methodCreate 
 GMethod Taper_methodCreate(const char *s)
new_Taper 
 Taper new_Taper(const char *type,
                 int width,
                 int minpts,
                 int maxpts)
Create a new Taper object. Taper is a GMethod that applies a taper to a waveform. Taper types are "hamming", "hanning", "cosine", "cosineBeg", "parzen", and "none".

Parameters:
type - The type of taper.
width - The width of the taper (as a % of the waveform length), if the type is "cosine" or "cosineBeg".
minpts - The minimum length of the taper, if the type is cosine or cosineBeg.
maxpts - The maximum length of the taper, if the type is cosine or cosineBeg.
Returns:
a Taper object, or NULL if malloc fails (logErrorMsg will be called)
Taper_hann 
 void Taper_hann(float *x,
                 int n)
Apply a Hanning taper.
Taper_hamm 
 void Taper_hamm(float *x,
                 int n)
Apply a Hamming taper.
Taper_parzen 
 void Taper_parzen(float *x,
                   int n)
Apply a Parzen taper.
Taper_cosine 
 void Taper_cosine(float *x,
                   int n,
                   double beg_len,
                   double end_len)
Apply a cosine taper.

Parameters:
x - The data to be tapered.
n - The number of samples in data[].
beg_len - The length of the taper at the beginning of the data as a percentage of n.
end_len - The length of the taper at the end of the data as a percentage of n.
